meanings.definition: Loaded onto a vehicle or vessel for transportation.
meanings.sent1: The truck onloaded the boxes for delivery.
meanings.sent2: The workers onloaded the cargo onto the ship.
meanings.sent3: The elephants onloaded the circus equipment onto the trailer.
meanings.sent4: The ants onloaded the food onto their tiny backs.
meanings.sent5: The students onloaded their backpacks with books for the school trip.

meanings.definition: Having a full or heavy load.
meanings.sent1: The truck felt onloaded with all the furniture.
meanings.sent2: She struggled to carry the onloaded bags of groceries.
meanings.sent3: The tree looked onloaded with ripe fruits ready to fall.
meanings.sent4: His backpack seemed onloaded with rocks instead of books.
meanings.sent5: The donkey appeared onloaded with hay as it walked slowly.

meanings.definition: Having data or content fully loaded onto a device or platform.
meanings.sent1: The website was onloaded with new videos for the users.
meanings.sent2: Her phone was onloaded with the latest app updates.
meanings.sent3: The computer screen seemed onloaded with too many tabs open.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt onloaded with information after studying all night.
meanings.sent5: The server was onloaded with requests during peak hours.
